oai_dc:dc.dc:description: He changes himself into a jackal, and goes to find out what is detaining his people, when they do not return home. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-19. 5506 rev.-5512 rev.). Sorcerers' hearts become stars and come out of the sky when they die. In the form of a jackal, sorcerers seek people from their homes at night to see where they are and how they are doing. 1) See also About sorcerers: their death, their snoring work, earthquakes and the rain and !nuin-|kui-ten (who was a sorcerer or magician), 2) This story is found in Book V-19.
